message: Hi Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for sale. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get your hands on something truly valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit steep for me. Would you be willing to consider a price of $120?

I understand that $150 is a bit high for you, but I'm not willing to go as low as $120. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $135. It's a fair price considering the value this product can bring to you.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but $135 is still a bit high for me. Would you be willing to consider a price of $125?

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $125. I'm willing to give you a small concession, so I'm offering $130. It's the lowest I can go without losing money on the deal.
I appreciate your willingness to give a small concession, but $130 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $125 and $130, so I'll offer $127.50. Can you consider that?

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, and I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. However, I'm still not comfortable going as low as $127.50. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm offering $129. It's the best I can do without losing money on the deal.
I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, but $129 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $128, but no higher. Can you meet me at that price?

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, and I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $128. However, I'm still not comfortable selling the product at that price. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm offering $129.50. It's the best I can do without losing money on the deal.
